snippet: Kurdistan, the region of Iraq whose fortunes improved as a result of American involvement, is at an anxious turning point now that the troops are gone and a political crisis has emerged.
abstract: Erbil Journal; Kurdistan region of Iraq has reaped significant benefits as a result of American military protection, and area has the most to lose following departure of US forces; consolidation of power by Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki evokes painful memories of Kurdish suffering at the hands of a powerful central government; Kurdish minority must now decide how best to participate in the politics of a country that stands at the brink of civil war.
lead_paragraph: Kurdistan, the region of Iraq whose fortunes improved as a result of American involvement, is at an anxious turning point now that the troops are gone and a political crisis has emerged.

headline.seo: Anxious Turning Point for Kurds in Iraq
headline.main: Iraq’s Factional Chaos Threatens to Disrupt a Kurdish Haven
headline.print_headline: Iraq’s Factional Chaos Threatens to Disrupt A Kurdish Haven
